It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, moist climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Parrya kuramensis is considered a critically endangered species.
